p: Patel et al. observed that a crude extract of Dodonaea viscosa was not able to inhibit proteinase and phospholipase activities in C. albicans. However, the presence of phytosterol and tannins in the extract may have caused extensive cellular damage, including cell wall damage [ 9 ]. It was revealed that the susceptibility or resistance of a fungus to the antifungal activity of an EO depends on the capacity of their main compounds. In this study, the presence of C. carvi EO (0.5Ã—MIC) caused a significant reduction in CSH similar to fluconazole.
